result.execSummary:
The defendant Tammy R. Wells was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay will be tax intercept, suspension and/or civil judgment.

Must provide DNA sample and pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge to the Clerk of Court Office within 30 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay will be tax intercept, suspension and/or civil judgment.   Defendant may request expungement of the DNA sample under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4) by petitioning the Wisconsin Department of Justice. Expungement of DNA is NOT a court process. 
For information see: http://www.doj.state.wi.us/dles/crime-labs/clb-forms.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

timeConds.notes: Banked for use by probation agent if necessary. Subject to work release. Not subject to good time.

supervisions.notes: Subject to Work Release & Good Time.

May not vote or hold public office until civil rights are restored.  Other civil rights may be lost until restored.  If not a U.S. Citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
**Eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.**
May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.

Count 2-DRI

Trauma evaluation/ACES score & comply with recommendations.  DNA sample, $250 surcharge.  Payable thru probation, ftp-judgment.  No fine.  2 days credit.  May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.
